etymologies: 1940s: from so(und) na(vigation and) r(anging), on the pattern of radar

definitions: a system for the detection of objects under water and for measuring the water's depth by emitting sound pulses and detecting or measuring their return after being reflected
shortDefinitions: system for detection of objects under water

definitions: an apparatus used in a sonar system

examples.text: we reduced the sensitivity of our scanning sonars

definitions: the method of echolocation used in air or water by animals such as bats or whales

examples.text: the fishing nets are detectable by dolphin sonar

shortDefinitions: method of echolocation used in air or water by animals such as whales and bats
